p: The EEs of heat treated M. communis L. leaves were evaluated for the antioxidant activity using the DPPH, the β-carotene bleaching method and ABTS .+ radical scavenging activity assay and compared to BHT. The antioxidant capacity is directly related to the content of phenolic compounds [ 5]. In this study, myrtle ethanolic extracts showed in general high antioxidant capacities significantly dependent on the employed drying methodology (Table 2).
